sect1.title: Step 3 - Get the whole chain working
sect1.para: Now that we have ensured that basic connectivity to the Wolframe server is available, we can configure the basics for the Qt client.

We start the Qt client with:
qtclient -s tutorial.conf -d
On first run we get presented a preferences dialog. Just accept the defaults.

When terminating the client you will find a settings file called ~/tutorial/client/client.conf:
[wolframe] host=localhost port=7661 secure=false checkSSL=true client-cert-file=./certs/client.crt client-key-file=./private/client.key ca-cert-file=./certs/CAclient.cert.pem uiloadmode=LocalFile dataloadmode=Network dbname=./data.db debug=false uiFormDir=. uiFormTranslationsDir=. uiFormResourcesDir=. dataLoaderDir=. locale=en_US
We get a login screen were we just hit the "Login" button.

Because we didn't write any user interfaces yet, we get an error message:
Unable to load form 'init', does it exist?
To get rid of that error message we will have to create our start form in the Qt designer first. For now we just click away the error message.
We get an empty window, we can go to "Help", "Debug Terminal". Also here we can test the protocol as in a telnet client.
Type quit, then Enter in the debug window or exit the Qt application over the menu.
We start now the Qt designer and create an empty QWidget form named ~/tutorial/client/init.ui and save it.
If we start the client now we see the same empty window again, but this time it's the dynamically loaded initial form (which is again empty). And the previous error message disappeared.
